page.title: 06LIFE AS A TRAVELLER PART 1
page.content: I am a traveller named Lena Waller living in a caravan. Sometimes at school I say a word that travellers use & they do not understand. So I will tell you some - dickeye means look; cacker means look, be quiet; borrie means big; chavie means child; chavo means boy; chave is a girl; gry means horse; Jook is a dog; gaver is a Policeman; warrt means look & kipsy is a basket. We have a fire outside. We sometimes cook around the outside fire. Travellers move quite a lot. We move three times a year. In the winter I live in Selling and then I move to Norton, Guiness Hop Farms. When the hop season is over we move back to Selling. Not so many Travellers visit Lynsted because there isn't so much work nowadays. In the morning when I get up my mum & dad have already gone to work doing cherry picking .
